intro: Townsendia spathulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves and its showy, blue-to-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and desert scrub habitats. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
